Understate: The claim may understate the fact that the image of the 1000 rupee banknote is not real, as it is described as "misleading" and the text on the banknote itself states 'Artistic Imagination'.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or official announcement from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) about the issuance of new 1000 rupee banknotes.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the image of the 1000 rupee banknote is genuine and implies that it has been issued by the RBI, which is not supported by any official sources.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists that the image of the 1000 rupee banknote is a result of artistic imagination or a hoax, as mentioned by the RBI spokesperson and the text on the banknote itself.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the RBI has not released any official statement or press release regarding the issuance of new 1000 rupee banknotes.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the significance of the image by stating that a new 1000 rupee banknote has been released, when in fact it is a misleading image with no official confirmation or existence.
